title: Never go Back
body_text:
The prospect of David Moyes returning to Everton fills me with anger, hatred and other vile thoughts. I totally despise the man ‚Äì and I don‚Äôt think he‚Äôs a very good manager. He is not someone I want to see managing Everton Football Club again.
I want to say it‚Äôs a huge mistake by The Friedkin Group but nobody knows how it will pan out. He may succeed‚Ä¶ but then some Everton fans claim those painful 11 years when he was Kenwright‚Äôs poodle were a success for him and for Everton. Whereas all I remember is failure:
‚Ä¢ Failure in Champions League
‚Ä¢ Failure to beat any of the top teams
‚Ä¢ Failure in the FA Cup semi-final against Liverpool
‚Ä¢ Failure in FA Cup Final against Chelsea
If appointed, as seems to be happening today, he indeed may do what it takes to keep Everton in the Premier League this season. There‚Äôs a massive risk, however, that he may not‚Ä¶ and that would be an incredible and indelible blight on TFG‚Äôs ownership, an unforgivable disaster that would be down to both him and them.
Never go back: he just should not even be anywhere near consideration for the job. I‚Äôm going to compile some of the more pertinent opinions and bombard every Everton email I can find in an attempt to let them know how much this dreadful decision will split the fanbase.
